content.question: In lines 14-15 (liceat . . . dextrae), we learn that

choices.label: Dido preserves the memory of her former husband
Juno is willing to see Dido marry a Trojan
Juno has acquired a Carthaginian dowry
Venus has joined the hands of Dido and Aeneas in marriage

content.answer: Juno is willing to see Dido marry a Trojan

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
